## ضوابط التمويل الاستهلاكى

These Regulations shall be applicable to Financing Contracts and all related Guarantee Agreements SAMA is the sole authority empowered to apply these appropriate regarding any violations of these provisions, including imposing punitive charges and or enforcement actions as applicable under the Banking Control These Regulations supersede and replace the and its subsequent updates SAMA may update these Regulations as and when required

SAMA may , at its discretion, impose a restriction on a Creditor under which its Consumer Financing portfolio may not exceed a specified percentage of its total Financing portfolio.

## DEFINITIONS

## Definitions

Each of the following words and phrases, wherever it appears in this Regulation, shall have the meaning following itin this article unless the context indicates otherwise:

Adequate notice: a printed notice to a Borrower that sets forth clearly the pertinent facts so that the Borrower may reasonably be expected to have noticed it and understood its meaning  The notice may be given by Guaranteed Communication Means reasonably assuring receipt by the Borrower product

Amount of Financing: the limit or the total amount Financing

## SECTION ONE SCOPE OF APPLICATION

## Article 2:   Application of the Regulations

- These Regulations apply to all kinds of Financing
- These Regulations do not apply to lease or real estate Financing or margin lending
- For the purposes ofthese Regulations, Consumer Financing is granted under a Financing Contract in case of any of the following:
- The repayment ofa debr owed by a person (the Borrower ) to another (the Creditor) is deferred; or
- person ( Borrower ) incurs a deferred debt to another ( Creditor)
- (2) I4(1), the Creditor must calculate the Amount of Financing based on the entitlement (as the case may be) when the application for Financing is submitted

- is the Annual Percentage Rate (APR)
- For the purpose of calculating APR, periods between dates shall be based on a year of 12 equal months
- (3) For the purpose of calculating APR, the Total Amount Payable by the Borrower shall be determined, including all unavoidable costs and exception of charges and fees by the Borrower as a result of noncompliance with any of his commitments laid down in the Financing Contract payable
- The calculation of the APR must be based on the assumption that the Financing Contract will remain valid for the agreed period and that the Creditor and the Borrower will fulfil their obligations under the terms specified in the Financing Contract
- Ifthe Financing Contract contains clauses allowing variations in the charges contained in the APR but unquantifiable at the time of calculation , the APR shall be calculated on the assumption that the charges will remain fixed at the initial level and will remain applicable until
- The Annual Percentage Rate must be calculated and expressed in percentage with minimum two basis points and the portion ofa basis being rounded to one full points point point
